result.markdown:
--- title: "Regression and Statistical Inference" --- # Assignment 3 In the data folder you find a data set car_prices.rds. It is slightly modified of the data set you could also find on Kaggle, the largest data science community worldwide hosting published code and data for a whole variety of applications. Check it out if you are interested! Again, open a new .R script/file and name it 02_reg.R. Then, you should accomplish the following tasks. * Read the data and check the dimensions. How many rows and how many columns does the data have? You could use e.g. the dim() command. * Use appropriate commands to get a more detailed look at the data. What data types do you see? How do numbers differ from strings regarding their data type? * Run a linear regression. You want to explain what factors are relevant for the pricing of a car. * Choose one regressor and + explain what data type it is and what values it can take on + what effect is has on the price and what changing the value would have as a result + whether its effect is statistically significant. * Add a variable seat_heating to the data and assign a value TRUE for all observations. You can use e.g. df %>% mutate(new_variable = value). Assign it to a new object and run a regression. What coefficient do you get for the new variable seat_heating and how can you explain it? ## Assignment 3.1 ::: {.cell hash='03_regression_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_6a00287a2f41d30959bbec1a327d4e46'} ```{.r .cell-code} #Read the data and check dimensions data <- readRDS("data/car_prices.rds") dim(data) # Check dimensions - rows and columns ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] 181 22 ``` ::: ::: ## Assignment 3.2 ::: {.cell hash='03_regression_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_39378fbb28f8bc38979850781fbdcec7'} ```{.r .cell-code} #Get a more detailed look at the data str(data) # Display structure and data types ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> tibble [181 × 22] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #> $ aspiration : chr [1:181] "std" "std" "std" "std" ... #> $ doornumber : chr [1:181] "two" "two" "two" "four" ... #> $ carbody : chr [1:181] "convertible" "convertible" "hatchback" "sedan" ... #> $ drivewheel : chr [1:181] "rwd" "rwd" "rwd" "fwd" ... #> $ enginelocation : chr [1:181] "front" "front" "front" "front" ... #> $ wheelbase : num [1:181] 88.6 88.6 94.5 99.8 99.4 ... #> $ carlength : num [1:181] 169 169 171 177 177 ... #> $ carwidth : num [1:181] 64.1 64.1 65.5 66.2 66.4 66.3 71.4 71.4 71.4 67.9 ... #> $ carheight : num [1:181] 48.8 48.8 52.4 54.3 54.3 53.1 55.7 55.7 55.9 52 ... #> $ curbweight : num [1:181] 2548 2548 2823 2337 2824 ... #> $ enginetype : chr [1:181] "dohc" "dohc" "ohcv" "ohc" ... #> $ cylindernumber : chr [1:181] "four" "four" "six" "four" ... #> $ enginesize : num [1:181] 130 130 152 109 136 136 136 136 131 131 ... #> $ fuelsystem : chr [1:181] "mpfi" "mpfi" "mpfi" "mpfi" ... #> $ boreratio : num [1:181] 3.47 3.47 2.68 3.19 3.19 3.19 3.19 3.19 3.13 3.13 ... #> $ stroke : num [1:181] 2.68 2.68 3.47 3.4 3.4 3.4 3.4 3.4 3.4 3.4 ... #> $ compressionratio: num [1:181] 9 9 9 10 8 8.5 8.5 8.5 8.3 7 ... #> $ horsepower : num [1:181] 111 111 154 102 115 110 110 110 140 160 ... #> $ peakrpm : num [1:181] 5000 5000 5000 5500 5500 5500 5500 5500 5500 5500 ... #> $ citympg : num [1:181] 21 21 19 24 18 19 19 19 17 16 ... #> $ highwaympg : num [1:181] 27 27 26 30 22 25 25 25 20 22 ... #> $ price : num [1:181] 13495 16500 16500 13950 17450 ... ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} glimpse(data) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> Rows: 181 #> Columns: 22 #> $ aspiration "std", "std", "std", "std", "std", "std", "std", "std… #> $ doornumber "two", "two", "two", "four", "four", "two", "four", "… #> $ carbody "convertible", "convertible", "hatchback", "sedan", "… #> $ drivewheel "rwd", "rwd", "rwd", "fwd", "4wd", "fwd", "fwd", "fwd… #> $ enginelocation "front", "front", "front", "front", "front", "front",… #> $ wheelbase 88.6, 88.6, 94.5, 99.8, 99.4, 99.8, 105.8, 105.8, 105… #> $ carlength 168.8, 168.8, 171.2, 176.6, 176.6, 177.3, 192.7, 192.… #> $ carwidth 64.1, 64.1, 65.5, 66.2, 66.4, 66.3, 71.4, 71.4, 71.4,… #> $ carheight 48.8, 48.8, 52.4, 54.3, 54.3, 53.1, 55.7, 55.7, 55.9,… #> $ curbweight 2548, 2548, 2823, 2337, 2824, 2507, 2844, 2954, 3086,… #> $ enginetype "dohc", "dohc", "ohcv", "ohc", "ohc", "ohc", "ohc", "… #> $ cylindernumber "four", "four", "six", "four", "five", "five", "five"… #> $ enginesize 130, 130, 152, 109, 136, 136, 136, 136, 131, 131, 108… #> $ fuelsystem "mpfi", "mpfi", "mpfi", "mpfi", "mpfi", "mpfi", "mpfi… #> $ boreratio 3.47, 3.47, 2.68, 3.19, 3.19, 3.19, 3.19, 3.19, 3.13,… #> $ stroke 2.68, 2.68, 3.47, 3.40, 3.40, 3.40, 3.40, 3.40, 3.40,… #> $ compressionratio 9.00, 9.00, 9.00, 10.00, 8.00, 8.50, 8.50, 8.50, 8.30… #> $ horsepower 111, 111, 154, 102, 115, 110, 110, 110, 140, 160, 101… #> $ peakrpm 5000, 5000, 5000, 5500, 5500, 5500, 5500, 5500, 5500,… #> $ citympg 21, 21, 19, 24, 18, 19, 19, 19, 17, 16, 23, 23, 21, 2… #> $ highwaympg 27, 27, 26, 30, 22, 25, 25, 25, 20, 22, 29, 29, 28, 2… #> $ price 13495.00, 16500.00, 16500.00, 13950.00, 17450.00, 152… ``` ::: ::: For strings Character and for numbers Double data types are observed ## Assignment 3.3 ::: {.cell hash='03_regression_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_69e5b42415590fe4e61d044473f3fbf1'} ```{.r .cell-code} #We Run a linear regression model <- lm(price ~ ., data = data[, -20]) summary(model) # Check regression summary for coefficients, p-values, etc. ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> #> Call: #> lm(formula = price ~ ., data = data[, -20]) #> #> Residuals: #> Min 1Q Median 3Q Max #> -5715.4 -1192.9 -27.4 828.6 8978.4 #> #> Coefficients: #> Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) #> (Intercept) -3.553e+04 1.536e+04 -2.313 0.022149 * #> aspirationturbo 1.797e+03 1.035e+03 1.736 0.084626 . #> doornumbertwo 2.242e+02 5.695e+02 0.394 0.694471 #> carbodyhardtop -3.676e+03 1.421e+03 -2.587 0.010669 * #> carbodyhatchback -3.338e+03 1.235e+03 -2.702 0.007710 ** #> carbodysedan -2.296e+03 1.353e+03 -1.697 0.091801 . #> carbodywagon -3.444e+03 1.486e+03 -2.317 0.021887 * #> drivewheelfwd -4.314e+02 1.066e+03 -0.405 0.686166 #> drivewheelrwd -1.558e+01 1.265e+03 -0.012 0.990190 #> enginelocationrear 6.858e+03 2.535e+03 2.705 0.007659 ** #> wheelbase -3.977e+01 9.086e+01 -0.438 0.662247 #> carlength -2.392e+01 5.042e+01 -0.474 0.635924 #> carwidth 7.244e+02 2.436e+02 2.974 0.003444 ** #> carheight 1.163e+02 1.337e+02 0.870 0.385828 #> curbweight 2.621e+00 1.776e+00 1.475 0.142293 #> enginetypedohcv -7.913e+03 4.595e+03 -1.722 0.087168 . #> enginetypel 1.101e+03 1.768e+03 0.623 0.534398 #> enginetypeohc 3.440e+03 9.141e+02 3.764 0.000243 *** #> enginetypeohcf 8.991e+02 1.616e+03 0.556 0.578818 #> enginetypeohcv -6.170e+03 1.230e+03 -5.018 1.52e-06 *** #> cylindernumberfive -1.154e+04 2.992e+03 -3.856 0.000173 *** #> cylindernumberfour -1.135e+04 3.147e+03 -3.605 0.000429 *** #> cylindernumbersix -6.918e+03 2.200e+03 -3.144 0.002023 ** #> cylindernumberthree -4.249e+03 4.676e+03 -0.909 0.365015 #> cylindernumbertwelve -1.101e+04 4.181e+03 -2.633 0.009386 ** #> enginesize 1.257e+02 2.647e+01 4.749 4.89e-06 *** #> fuelsystem2bbl 2.203e+02 8.779e+02 0.251 0.802254 #> fuelsystemmfi -3.116e+03 2.567e+03 -1.214 0.226855 #> fuelsystemmpfi 4.302e+02 9.905e+02 0.434 0.664720 #> fuelsystemspdi -2.523e+03 1.360e+03 -1.856 0.065553 . #> fuelsystemspfi 5.316e+02 2.493e+03 0.213 0.831430 #> boreratio -1.219e+03 1.630e+03 -0.748 0.455731 #> stroke -4.583e+03 9.148e+02 -5.009 1.58e-06 *** #> compressionratio -7.785e+02 5.495e+02 -1.417 0.158716 #> horsepower 1.139e+01 2.256e+01 0.505 0.614476 #> peakrpm 2.522e+00 6.325e-01 3.988 0.000105 *** #> highwaympg 7.601e+01 8.220e+01 0.925 0.356679 #> --- #> Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #> #> Residual standard error: 2184 on 144 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared: 0.9414, Adjusted R-squared: 0.9267 #> F-statistic: 64.24 on 36 and 144 DF, p-value: < 2.2e-16 ``` ::: ::: We want to now consider seeing p-values for selecting significant regressors affecting price and we construct a barplot with alpha set to 0.05 and shown with red dotted line. All those variables with p-value greater than 0.05 we don't consider them. ::: {.cell hash='03_regression_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_46adb20c637dcad6962254c2e1eee6ff'} ```{.r .cell-code} #Extracting p-values of regressors from the summary of the regression model p_values <- summary(model)$coefficients[, "Pr(>|t|)"] p_values ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> (Intercept) aspirationturbo doornumbertwo #> 2.214873e-02 8.462557e-02 6.944711e-01 #> carbodyhardtop carbodyhatchback carbodysedan #> 1.066928e-02 7.710289e-03 9.180131e-02 #> carbodywagon drivewheelfwd drivewheelrwd #> 2.188745e-02 6.861656e-01 9.901899e-01 #> enginelocationrear wheelbase carlength #> 7.658904e-03 6.622471e-01 6.359238e-01 #> carwidth carheight curbweight #> 3.443999e-03 3.858277e-01 1.422933e-01 #> enginetypedohcv enginetypel enginetypeohc #> 8.716763e-02 5.343980e-01 2.431410e-04 #> enginetypeohcf enginetypeohcv cylindernumberfive #> 5.788177e-01 1.518253e-06 1.731842e-04 #> cylindernumberfour cylindernumbersix cylindernumberthree #> 4.293199e-04 2.022597e-03 3.650153e-01 #> cylindernumbertwelve enginesize fuelsystem2bbl #> 9.386403e-03 4.887489e-06 8.022540e-01 #> fuelsystemmfi fuelsystemmpfi fuelsystemspdi #> 2.268549e-01 6.647200e-01 6.555294e-02 #> fuelsystemspfi boreratio stroke #> 8.314303e-01 4.557306e-01 1.576896e-06 #> compressionratio horsepower peakrpm #> 1.587161e-01 6.144755e-01 1.054750e-04 #> highwaympg #> 3.566786e-01 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Extracting names of the regressors regressor_names <- names(p_values) # Create a bar plot to visualize the significance of regressors barplot(-log10(p_values), names.arg = regressor_names, main = "Significance of Regressors on Car Prices", xlab = "Regressors", ylab = "-log10(p-value)", col = "lightblue", ylim = c(0, max(-log10(p_values)) * 1.2), las = 2, # Rotate x-axis labels vertically cex.names = 0.7) # Add a horizontal dashed line at significance level (for example, p = 0.05) abline(h = -log10(0.05), lty = 2, col = "red") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](03_regression_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Determine significance levels based on p-values significance_levels <- ifelse(p_values <= 0.001, "***", ifelse(p_values <= 0.01, "**", ifelse(p_values <= 0.05, "*", ""))) # Filter significant regressors whose p-values are less than 0.05 significant_regressors <- regressor_names[p_values < 0.05] # Create a table of significant regressors along with their significance levels significant_table <- data.frame( Regressors = significant_regressors, P_Values = p_values[p_values < 0.05], Significance = significance_levels[p_values < 0.05] ) significant_table ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Include only significant regressors model_imp <- lm(price ~ enginelocation + enginesize + stroke + carwidth + peakrpm, data = data) summary(model_imp) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> #> Call: #> lm(formula = price ~ enginelocation + enginesize + stroke + carwidth + #> peakrpm, data = data) #> #> Residuals: #> Min 1Q Median 3Q Max #> -9332 -1532 -235 1132 15349 #> #> Coefficients: #> Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) #> (Intercept) -6.886e+04 1.055e+04 -6.529 6.91e-10 *** #> enginelocationrear 1.100e+04 1.987e+03 5.536 1.11e-07 *** #> enginesize 1.355e+02 8.905e+00 15.211 < 2e-16 *** #> stroke -2.768e+03 7.194e+02 -3.847 0.000167 *** #> carwidth 9.568e+02 1.671e+02 5.725 4.41e-08 *** #> peakrpm 2.023e+00 5.634e-01 3.591 0.000427 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #> #> Residual standard error: 2948 on 175 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared: 0.8702, Adjusted R-squared: 0.8665 #> F-statistic: 234.7 on 5 and 175 DF, p-value: < 2.2e-16 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Extract the coefficients of significant regressors from the regression model summary significant_regressors <- c("enginelocationrear", "enginesize", "stroke", "carwidth", "peakrpm") # Extract the coefficients and variable names coefficients <- coef(model)[significant_regressors] # Create a bar plot to visualize the impact of significant regressors on price barplot(coefficients, main = "Impact of Significant Regressors on Car Prices", xlab = "Regressors", ylab = "Coefficient Estimate", col = "skyblue", ylim = c(min(coefficients) * 1.2, max(coefficients) * 1.2), las = 2, # Rotate x-axis labels vertically beside = TRUE) # Add labels for the variables text(1:length(coefficients), coefficients, labels = round(coefficients, digits = 2), pos = 3, cex = 0.8) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](03_regression_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-2.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## Assignment 3.4 Now for this part enginesize is selected based on its p-value (4.887489e-06) and significance and also a positive correletion based on the plot and positive estimate of 125.72 show that as enginesize increases, price also increases. The data type of enginesize is double and it is statistically significant since its p-value is less than alpha= 0.05. ::: {.cell hash='03_regression_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_2fe2cc86df082a8f3c45b250cf2aa21a'} ```{.r .cell-code} # Plot relationship between enginesize and price ggplot(data, aes(x = enginesize, y = price)) + geom_point(alpha = 0.8) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](03_regression_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell hash='03_regression_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_125d89e47a531b8b816aa209bc4288dd'} ```{.r .cell-code} # Step 5: Add a new variable 'seat_heating' and run regression data_with_seat_heating <- data %>% mutate(seat_heating = TRUE) model_with_seat_heating <- lm(price ~ ., data = data_with_seat_heating) summary(model_with_seat_heating) # Check regression summary for the coefficient of seat_heating ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> #> Call: #> lm(formula = price ~ ., data = data_with_seat_heating) #> #> Residuals: #> Min 1Q Median 3Q Max #> -5662 -1120 0 798 9040 #> #> Coefficients: (1 not defined because of singularities) #> Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) #> (Intercept) -36269.965 15460.866 -2.346 0.020354 * #> aspirationturbo 1846.206 1041.391 1.773 0.078386 . #> doornumbertwo 242.523 571.929 0.424 0.672172 #> carbodyhardtop -3691.743 1424.825 -2.591 0.010561 * #> carbodyhatchback -3344.335 1238.359 -2.701 0.007757 ** #> carbodysedan -2292.820 1356.014 -1.691 0.093043 . #> carbodywagon -3427.921 1490.285 -2.300 0.022885 * #> drivewheelfwd -504.564 1076.623 -0.469 0.640030 #> drivewheelrwd -15.446 1268.070 -0.012 0.990299 #> enginelocationrear 6643.492 2572.275 2.583 0.010806 * #> wheelbase -30.197 92.776 -0.325 0.745294 #> carlength -29.740 51.672 -0.576 0.565824 #> carwidth 731.819 244.533 2.993 0.003258 ** #> carheight 123.195 134.607 0.915 0.361617 #> curbweight 2.612 1.781 1.467 0.144706 #> enginetypedohcv -8541.957 4749.685 -1.798 0.074219 . #> enginetypel 978.748 1786.384 0.548 0.584619 #> enginetypeohc 3345.252 933.001 3.585 0.000461 *** #> enginetypeohcf 972.919 1625.631 0.598 0.550462 #> enginetypeohcv -6222.322 1236.415 -5.033 1.43e-06 *** #> cylindernumberfive -11724.540 3019.192 -3.883 0.000157 *** #> cylindernumberfour -11549.326 3177.177 -3.635 0.000387 *** #> cylindernumbersix -7151.398 2247.230 -3.182 0.001793 ** #> cylindernumberthree -4318.929 4688.833 -0.921 0.358545 #> cylindernumbertwelve -11122.209 4196.494 -2.650 0.008946 ** #> enginesize 125.934 26.541 4.745 5.00e-06 *** #> fuelsystem2bbl 177.136 883.615 0.200 0.841400 #> fuelsystemmfi -3041.018 2576.996 -1.180 0.239934 #> fuelsystemmpfi 359.278 1001.529 0.359 0.720326 #> fuelsystemspdi -2543.890 1363.546 -1.866 0.064140 . #> fuelsystemspfi 514.766 2499.229 0.206 0.837107 #> boreratio -1306.740 1642.221 -0.796 0.427516 #> stroke -4527.137 922.732 -4.906 2.49e-06 *** #> compressionratio -737.901 555.960 -1.327 0.186539 #> horsepower 10.293 22.709 0.453 0.651035 #> peakrpm 2.526 0.634 3.983 0.000108 *** #> citympg -90.352 166.647 -0.542 0.588538 #> highwaympg 154.858 167.148 0.926 0.355761 #> seat_heatingTRUE NA NA NA NA #> --- #> Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #> #> Residual standard error: 2189 on 143 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared: 0.9415, Adjusted R-squared: 0.9264 #> F-statistic: 62.21 on 37 and 143 DF, p-value: < 2.2e-16 ``` ::: ::: Adding a variable seat_heating to the data and assigning a value TRUE for all observations gave a NA for Estimate coefficient in the new regression model. This new variable has no affect on the price since it is same for all observations.
